command: var1="global.ini/system_replication/enable_full_sync"; sudo su - $sidadm -c "HDBSettings.sh getParameter.py --key=$var1" | grep -o "'$var1':\s*'[^']*'" | grep -o "'[^']*'$" | tr -d "'"
check_description: Full Sync Option for SAP HANA System Replication
recommendation:
If the secondary system gets disconnected transaction processing on the primary/source will be suspended until the secondary system becomes available again. When customer is very particular about zero RPO.
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_HANA_PLATFORM/009e68bc5f3c440cb31823a3ec4bb95b/514ab38a2e574c85a70ebba80ff16d99.html#loio514ab38a2e574c85a70ebba80ff16d99__configSPS06_id_978

command: var1="global.ini/ha_dr_provider_SAPHanaSR/provider"; sudo su - $sidadm -c "HDBSettings.sh getParameter.py --key=$var1" | grep -o "'$var1':\s*'[^']*'" | grep -o "'[^']*'$" | tr -d "'"
check_description: Enabling the SAP HANA srConnectionChanged() hook -   SAPHanaSR - provider ?

command: var1="global.ini/ha_dr_provider_SAPHanaSR/path"; sudo su - $sidadm -c "HDBSettings.sh getParameter.py --key=$var1" | grep -o "'$var1':\s*'[^']*'" | grep -o "'[^']*'$" | tr -d "'"
check_description: Enabling the SAP HANA srConnectionChanged() hook -   SAPHanaSR - provider ?

command: var1="global.ini/ha_dr_provider_SAPHanaSR/execution_order"; sudo su - $sidadm -c "HDBSettings.sh getParameter.py --key=$var1" | grep -o "'$var1':\s*'[^']*'" | grep -o "'[^']*'$" | tr -d "'"
check_description: Enabling the SAP HANA srConnectionChanged() hook -   SAPHanaSR - provider ?

command: var1="global.ini/trace/ha_dr_saphanasr"; sudo su - $sidadm -c "HDBSettings.sh getParameter.py --key=$var1" | grep -o "'$var1':\s*'[^']*'" | grep -o "'[^']*'$" | tr -d "'"
check_description: Enabling the SAP HANA srConnectionChanged() hook -   SAPHanaSR - provider ?
recommendation:
SAP HANA provide so-called "hooks" that allow SAP HANA to send out notifications for certain events. The srConnectionChanged() hook can be used to improve the ability of the HA cluster to detect when a change in the status of the SAP HANA System Replication occurs that requires the HA cluster to take action and to avoid data loss/data corruption by preventing accidental takeovers from being triggered in situations where this should be avoided.
https://docs.redhat.com/en/documentation/red_hat_enterprise_linux_for_sap_solutions/8/html/automating_sap_hana_scale-up_system_replication_using_the_rhel_ha_add-on/asmb_config_ha_cluster_automating-sap-hana-scale-up-system-replication#con_activate_hook_automating-sap-hana-scale-up-system-replication

command: var1="ha_dr_SAPHanaSR"; if [ $(sudo su - $sidadm -c "cdtrace; grep $var1 name*.trc | wc -l") -gt 1 ]; then echo "true"; else echo "false"; fi
check_description: Check if srConnection hook is enabled or not ?

command: var1="srConnectionChange"; if [ $(sudo su - $sidadm -c "cdtrace; grep $var1 name*.trc | wc -l") -gt 1 ]; then echo "true"; else echo "false"; fi
check_description: Check if srConnection hook is enabled or not ?

command: systemctl status pcsd.service | grep Active: | awk -F ' ' '{print$2}'
check_description: Ensure the pcs service is running?
Corosync token timeout
Time delay before executing fencing
Pacemaker reboot action
Maximum number of times to retry the reboot
Alternate timeout (in seconds) to use for reboot actions
Timeout period for power-related operations?
Cluster defaults resource-stickiness ?
Cluster defaults migration threshold ?
Should the resource agent prefer to switch over to the secondary instance instead of restarting the primary locally?
A time difference is needed between two primary time stamps if a dual-primary situation occurs before the cluster will react?
If a takeover event has occurred, should the former primary instance be registered as secondary?
recommendation:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/sap-hana-on-aws-saphanatopology-1.html
If a takeover event has occurred should the former primary instance be registered as secondary? ("false": no manual intervention will be needed; "true": yes the former primary will be registered by the resource agent as secondary); If the AUTOMATED_REGISTER parameter is set to true the secondary instance will automatically register after startup and start the replication

command: var1="global.ini/system_replication/operation_mode"; sudo su - $sidadm -c "HDBSettings.sh getParameter.py --key=$var1" | grep -o "'$var1':\s*'[^']*'" | grep -o "'[^']*'$" | tr -d "'"
check_description: System replication operation mode
recommendation:
While registering the secondary system you need to decide in which operation mode to run SAP HANA system replication.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sap/latest/sap-hana/sap-hana-on-aws-aws-infrastructure-operating-system-setup-and-hana-installation.html;
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_HANA_PLATFORM/4e9b18c116aa42fc84c7dbfd02111aba/627bd11e86c84ec2b9fcdf585d24011c.html
https://docs.redhat.com/en/documentation/red_hat_enterprise_linux_for_sap_solutions/8/html/automating_sap_hana_scale-up_system_replication_using_the_rhel_ha_add-on/asmb_configure_sap_hana_replication_automating-sap-hana-scale-up-system-replication#con_secondary_replication_automating-sap-hana-scale-up-system-replication
